name: Chelsea Nolan
text:
I brought my son here the other day for the first time, I wasn’t sure what to expect but the girl at the front area helped me with what to do. Basically at least one person has to have a season pass in order to visit, as I was originally planning on just paying for the day. However, i decided to go ahead and buy passes for us both.

I’m not a huge fan of the crowd, but that’s not something that is inherently problematic or something that can be remedied, so I don’t of mean to seem negative. I’m just used to my friend’s pool. However, now we have two options for swimming.

I’m SUPER impressed with the foods and snacks area btw! They offer chick fil A and dip n dots, among other things.

I will say that it is vastly different than the previous layout. That’s not a bad thing though; just nostalgia in my thoughts. With that being said, the new complex is ultra  modern and I’m thankful to be a member.

name: Katie Nichols
text: Great kids pool and a larger pool as well. Lifeguards seem very attentive.

name: Kevin Kwon
text: Good for family

name: Jackson Frey
text: Good pool. Has a diving board along with a kid pool.

name: Wes S
text: The pool and splashpad are fine as far as design.  However, the management of it, like the rest of Deer Creek neighborhood, leaves a lot to be desired.  The pool often closes early without notice and more than occasionally shuts down for a day or two at a time without notice.  Afterwards, the neighborhood never tells why it shut down.  Was it problems with the lifeguards?  Was it a pool chemical issue?  It's the management company and HOA's secret!

name: Dan Hughes
text: Okay for a neighborhood pool. Seems to be dirtier these days than previous seasons.

name: V Sensei
text: Its a little too small

name: Nicholas Nicholas
text: Great pool and clubhouse, very well maintained !

name: Margaret Hawkins
text: It was quiet chilly .lol

name: Misty Merilien
text: Fun place for the family to hang out.

name: Joy Millwood
text: Was at the Boaz swimming pool for my granddaughters swim meet. This was the last meet to be held there. Next year they'll be at the new complex. I hope they keep the pool open for people to use.

name: Nicholas Bearer (Nickstream)
text: Compared to other swimming pools this place is a bit lacking. Also the lifeguards will all take a break and swim and everyone else has to get out. You pay money and have to sit while they take their break??? It makes no sense that they can't rotate breaks out so all the people who pay money can continue to swim.

name: sarah white
text: Fun!!! Great staff, and clean area. Love taking my kids here!! Keep up the good work!!

name: Catrina Stephens
text: Clean. The kids always have fun. Helpful lifeguards and only $3 6 and under free

name: Jeffery Vernon
text: Awesome place and swim lessons with Mrs. Casey are the best the girls love it!

name: Kambre Alyssa
text: Awesome I love to be on swim team

name: Britany Cook
text: They need seating, maybe picnic tables under the small Pavillion. There were alot of unsupervised 11 and 12yo that were dropped off and were cussing at the little children. Other than that it was a great experience.

name: Donida Rigsby
text: My children had a fantastic experience

name: Silver Bear
text: Cost $3 to get in. Not to crowded for a Saturday. A few life guards. Downside there were lots of flys at the tables.

name: Demon Alexa
text: Rude ppl

name: Cheryl Phillips
text: Clean, friendly and lots of pool to swim in. Entry fee is reasonable.

name: Kristen Camacho (Luis Kristen Camacho)
text: Love it

name: Stacy Parker
text: Love taking the kids, its a great place to go and the price aint bad! The bathrooms could be cleaned better!!

name: Rudy Rawlings
text: It was nice.But the bathrooms needed some real deep cleaning.

name: Amanda Hopkins
text: Price is reasonable and staff is friendly, just wish they were open more days/hours.

name: Donald Taylor
text: Nice place for all

name: Vanda Peppers
text: Not open, very disappointed

name: wolf fox love11
text: Nice size and very clean

name: Charles Glover
text: Splash pad was ok pool was taken all day from the time they opened to the time they closed due to a ""contest""

name: Orlando Davis
text: Family  Oriented

name: Roxanne Brewer
text: We played @ pratt splash pad! ❤ it!

name: Lois Hays
text: Had a blast

name: Cole Mel
text: Today was a complete let down and slap in the face. Drove an HR to take the kids to get a good swim in for the day only to have it closed for employee swim time.... Although it said they were supposed to be cleaning, as why it was closed that day, but we saw zero cleaning. Alot of beach ball play, trying to see who could climb the metal rod the highest, they played a round of chicken with one another all while these kids were just trying to do the same with there day. It was upsetting and rude to say the least. This is why I don't go out. 🤦‍♀️

name: Greta Street
text: It's a great place you come alone or to bring kids. There's a large zero entry baby pool, lazy river, and water slide. Floats provided

name: Linda Scott
text: Great place to go swim.

name: Drew
text: I had a fun time resting in the lazy river and then sliding down a fun slide

name: Julia Beedle
text: They will not give you a refund for you to literally walk-in and 2 minutes later close the pool due to weather. Once the weather is clear they will continue not to reopen the pool and tell you continuously it will be 30 minutes. While sitting outside you will hear everyone that works at the pool cheer on to reset the clock even though the weather has been clear for over an hour and a half. Talked to the pool supervisor and the aquatic manager and they just laugh with zero care. I understand closing during the bad weather but don’t expect any of them to want to actually start back working again once they close.

name: JoAnna Locke
text: Awesome! Clean, very professional life guards, recommend for all partys!

name: Michael Hayes
text: Nice place. Clean water, lots of guards. Friendly staff and a fun slide. Great place to take family.

name: Rhonda Baccus
text: Didn't find out house 1 person didn't have ID. To get in??

name: Jessica Farr
text: Does anyone know if this costs ? And how much

name: Odins Nana
text: Always fantastic!! So happy the pools are finally open!!

name: Lindi Pearson
text: Amazing pool and renew membership every year

name: Sadie
text: Excellent pool, wonderful facilities. The splash playground makes me feel less guilty about not going to the crowded splash pads elsewhere around town and my 5 year old loves getting to swim in the big pool just as much. It's generally been fairly crowded when I've been but not unpleasantly so. They do a courtesy adult time every hour from what I can tell, they have anyone under... 14? Maybe 16? Get out or sit on the side of the pool (my son hates it but it makes a great opportunity to reapply his sunscreen while he can't swim, anyway... which reduces fighting for us.) It lasts maybe 10 minutes. They have a wave pool at one end that I love and two diving boards. Very much worth the price of membership if you're a Homewood resident, and you get access to several other amenities.

name: Leighann Denison
text: Best pool for smaller kids. Spent the entire Summer there. Can't wait for next Summer.

name: Mary Oakley Askew
text: it’s a fun place to hang out with your friends

name: Justin Weaver
text: A truly awesome community pool. The kids area is like a low key water park. Friendly staff, clean, great for residents of all ages.

name: Owen Stayner/ThisWorkplace360
text: One of my favorite places to sit and read

name: Mary Levey
text: It's fun
